hero.title: Kung Fu
hero.subtitle: One of the oldest forms of self-defense

intro.title: What is Kung Fu?
intro.description: Kung Fu is one of the oldest forms of self-defense, the predecessor to karate and ju-jitsu. The term signifies "training and discipline in the path toward an objective," which may involve health improvement, spiritual development, or personal defense.
intro.philosophy: The discipline emphasizes harmony with opponents rather than dominance. Practitioners seek "complementarity and not opposition" with their adversary, preserving themselves through balanced engagement.

techniques.title: Techniques & Training
techniques.description: Students learn blocking and striking techniques, forms (Tao Lu), positions, and kicks. Training develops both combat skills and mental discipline.

metadata.title: Krav Maga Reims | Effective Self Defense
metadata.description: Krav Maga and Self Defense classes in Reims with Grégory Bezruki, 8th Dan. Official system of the Israeli military. Simplicity, speed, effectiveness.

intro.title: What is Krav Maga?
intro.description: Krav Maga means "combat with contact" or "close-range fighting" in Hebrew. This discipline prioritizes effectiveness over aesthetics, teaching practical principles rather than rigid techniques or choreographed responses to coded attacks.
intro.philosophy: The ultimate goal is to achieve mastery where practitioners can "manage confrontations without causing irreparable harm to aggressors."

recognition.title: Official Recognition
recognition.description: Krav Maga is the official self-defense and combat system for Tsahal (Israeli military), Israeli police, and security services. Numerous U.S. law enforcement units, including the FBI, have adopted this system.

items.name: Simplicity
items.description: Simple and natural movements, accessible to everyone

training.title: Training Approach
training.description: Classes combine physical exercises, technical drills, and tactical scenarios designed to build mental discipline and stress-management capabilities.
training.approach: The methodology emphasizes adaptability and understanding underlying principles rather than memorizing fixed techniques.
training.stress: Emphasis is placed on reflexes and simplicity to remain effective even under intense stress.

accessibility.title: Accessible to Everyone
accessibility.description: The program features very simple movements that make it accessible to everyone, regardless of prior martial arts experience or fitness level.

instructor.title: Your Instructor
credentials: 8th Black Belt Krav Maga Self Defense
US Army Green Beret Combative Arts Instructor

cta.title: Learn to Defend Yourself

metadata.title: Jeet Kune Do Reims | Bruce Lee's Art

hero.title: Jeet Kune Do
hero.subtitle: The Way of the Intercepting Fist

intro.title: What is Jeet Kune Do?
intro.description: Jeet Kune Do, literally "the way of the intercepting fist," was established by Bruce Lee around 1967. This discipline emerged from his extensive research in human sciences, including kinesiology and physiology, analyzing how humans naturally move and fight.
intro.philosophy: Bruce Lee envisioned a martial system emphasizing "non-method" and "style without style," prioritizing total freedom—both athletic and spiritual—for practitioners over rigid systematic constraints.

brucelee.title: Bruce Lee's Legacy
brucelee.description: Bruce Lee recognized inherent limitations in all existing combat systems—even highly effective ones he himself had developed. His philosophy centers on understanding human behavior, motivations, and personal development.
brucelee.quote: "Absorb what is useful, discard what is useless, add what is uniquely your own."

synthesis.title: Martial Arts Synthesis
synthesis.description: The system draws from multiple martial arts, synthesizing effective techniques across disciplines:

instructor.title: Your Instructor
instructor.note: Bruce Lee remains the sole authentic master of the original system. Grégory Bezruki teaches the essential techniques of Jeet Kune Do.
credentials: Designated representative for France by Larry Hartsell
Instructor Diploma Joaquim Almeria Academy Las Vegas

cta.title: Discover Bruce Lee's Art
cta.description: Join our Jeet Kune Do classes and explore a free and effective approach to combat.

intro.title: What is Taichi Qigong?
intro.description: Taichi Qigong is a traditional Chinese gymnastics and breathing science founded on the knowledge and mastery of breath. This practice combines slow movements, breathing exercises, and concentration.
intro.history: This discipline represents a branch of traditional Chinese medicine with origins spanning over 3,000 years.

recognition.title: Official Recognition
recognition.description: In March 2013, the Paris Academy of Medicine officially recognized Qigong and Taichi as complementary therapies, establishing this practice as a legitimate wellness approach.

intro.description: Taekwondo, literally "the way of the foot and fist," is a martial art of Korean origin. Characterized by its spectacular leg techniques, it combines power, agility, and precision in a complete combat system.
intro.philosophy: This martial art develops not only physical capabilities but also character, self-confidence, and mental well-being of its practitioners.

intro.title: What is MMA?
intro.description: MMA (Mixed Martial Arts), formerly known as free fighting or pankration, is a striking-grappling combat sport. It combines the best techniques from multiple martial arts for a complete combat system.
intro.philosophy: MMA fuses striking techniques—kicks, punches, knees, and elbows—with grappling, throws, and submission techniques.

hero.title: Tai Chi Chuan
hero.subtitle: The Art of the Supreme Ultimate

intro.title: What is Tai Chi Chuan?
intro.description: Tai Chi Chuan (Taiji Quan) belongs to Chinese martial arts, drawing its name from the philosophical concept of "Taiji" or "supreme ultimate," representing the balance of Yin and Yang in Chinese thought.
intro.philosophy: The practice emphasizes calm and conscious movements in harmony with natural body laws, combined with deep breathing work.

distinction.title: Martial Art vs Gymnastics
distinction.description: Unlike Taichi Qi Gong (a gymnastics and breathing science), Tai Chi Chuan maintains its martial art classification while providing identical health benefits.
distinction.martial: Tai Chi Chuan is a true internal martial art, with combat and self-defense applications.

practice.title: The Practice
practice.description: Tai Chi Chuan cultivates balance between action and inaction in daily life.

benefits.title: Health Benefits

items.title: Kinesthetic Awareness

items.title: Daily Well-being
